snippet.textDisplay: I always wish there was more to do in this town. But you know what? The town of wind is come and go, filled with change despite the pillars, the people, perhaps remaining the same. What I'm trying to say is that, bitter sweetly, I like that it's so fleeting. Yet had the tune and time, to wax itself in to my roots.
snippet.textOriginal: I always wish there was more to do in this town. But you know what? The town of wind is come and go, filled with change despite the pillars, the people, perhaps remaining the same. What I'm trying to say is that, bitter sweetly, I like that it's so fleeting. Yet had the tune and time, to wax itself in to my roots.

snippet.textDisplay: I cant believe this game is 10 years old. I can remember my bro and I getting this off Ebay with the Strat guide (which I have in front of me before I got ToS CE the other day) And just not really thinking about it I played this game and it had and still has such an impact on my life. Its beautiful and like SupraDarky said when I heard this I just sat in town and listened to the music. I did this a couple of times. Im so glad I got the OST with my CE. I hope to cherish this forever. Keep playing games everybody! Go Tales of XIllia 2 and Tales of Zestiria!
snippet.textOriginal: I cant believe this game is 10 years old. I can remember my bro and I getting this off Ebay with the Strat guide (which I have in front of me before I got ToS CE the other day) And just not really thinking about it I played this game and it had and still has such an impact on my life. Its beautiful and like SupraDarky said when I heard this I just sat in town and listened to the music. I did this a couple of times. Im so glad I got the OST with my CE. I hope to cherish this forever. Keep playing games everybody! Go Tales of XIllia 2 and Tales of Zestiria!

snippet.textDisplay: people claim this story was simple... at no point in time until the end did you have any clue what the hell was actually going on...

snippet.textDisplay: I might be an animal then.... because the story was not simple at all.

snippet.textDisplay: A simple premise plus an epic journey, interesting characters, fantastic music and great great gameplay equals one heck of a masterpiece.
snippet.textOriginal: A simple premise plus an epic journey, interesting characters, fantastic music and great great gameplay equals one heck of a masterpiece.

snippet.textDisplay:
For its time, it was one of the most unique and enthralling story lines I'd ever seen. Hardly simple, there were alot of plot twists and great character development. The morality the characters experience in this game is the likes of which few games ever experience. You just have to play it all the way through to understand. At this town, you've barely scratched the surface.

4 years. Shit, you probably understand by now. If not, well, to each their own.
snippet.textOriginal:

The morality the characters experience in this game is the likes of which few games ever experience. You just have to play it all the way through to understand. At this town, you've barely scratched the surface.

4 years. Shit, you probably understand by now. If not, well, to each their own.

snippet.textDisplay: Played this game with my wife and a friend; both of whom had already played it before me.  They helped me along.  I remember this song the most because we kept coming back here time and again to see if we could trigger the event that gave Rain her ceremonial outfit that my wife loves.  Not a bad thing, mind you!  The song has entered the nostalgic part of my brain.
snippet.textOriginal: Played this game with my wife and a friend; both of whom had already played it before me.  They helped me along. Not a bad thing, mind you!  The song has entered the nostalgic part of my brain.

snippet.textDisplay: @kcclubkirby definetly! you know the story and the way everything wraps up is by far some of the best I've seen in a jrpg and that's sayin alot considering how many I've played=p when playing the game from the beginning, there is a considerate amount of well put foreshadowing and details that are easily missed without knowing about the events unfolding in the background

snippet.textDisplay: @MrAgnost Yup, and its always nice to meet people open to others viewpoints and opinions rather than having one narrow viewpoint and shunning the rest.
snippet.textOriginal: @MrAgnost Yup, and its always nice to meet people open to others viewpoints and opinions rather than having one narrow viewpoint and shunning the rest.

snippet.textDisplay: @MrAgnost This game for me was mostly nostalgia and seeing how the actions of the ToS1 group changed the world. To me this is what the creators were trying to convey that feeling of nostalgia. So when you enter the towns you can go, oh yeah...this is where etc. etc... I wouldn't have minded changing or adding more battle, dungeon, emotional moment themes but for things like characters and towns, I feel that having one main theme for those subjects to remember them is enough.
snippet.textOriginal: @MrAgnost This game for me was mostly nostalgia and seeing how the actions of the ToS1 group changed the world. To me this is what the creators were trying to convey that feeling of nostalgia. So when you enter the towns you can go, oh yeah...this is where etc. etc... I wouldn't have minded changing or adding more battle, dungeon, emotional moment themes but for things like characters and towns, I feel that having one main theme for those subjects to remember them is enough.

snippet.textDisplay: At first, when I played this game, it felt like a cliched RPG. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed it, but the story seemed a bit simple. However, once the game hits a certain point, the story takes a radical turn, and it becomes an engaging and creative story based on mythology. This song was also one of my favorites!
snippet.textOriginal: At first, when I played this game, it felt like a cliched RPG. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed it, but the story seemed a bit simple. However, once the game hits a certain point, the story takes a radical turn, and it becomes an engaging and creative story based on mythology. This song was also one of my favorites!

snippet.textDisplay:
It really wasn't that bad. I actually enjoyed it. I think for me I enjoyed it so much because i had low, I mean like below hell low, expectations for ToS 2.The plot really wasn't as life-changing as ToS but its hard to beat a game like ToS. 

Controls were very easy to get used to IMO nothing too overly complicated. Graphics eh who cares about graphics so much?  No upgrade on music? I don't see the problem with that. It felt great going back to the towns and hearing the familiar songs.
snippet.textOriginal:
It really wasn't that bad. I actually enjoyed it. I think for me I enjoyed it so much because i had low, I mean like below hell low, expectations for ToS 2.The plot really wasn't as life-changing as ToS but its hard to beat a game like ToS. 

Controls were very easy to get used to IMO nothing too overly complicated. Graphics eh who cares about graphics so much?  No upgrade on music? I don't see the problem with that. It felt great going back to the towns and hearing the familiar songs.

snippet.textDisplay: quite possibly my favorite game of all time.
snippet.textOriginal: quite possibly my favorite game of all time.

snippet.textDisplay:
If you loved the first Tales of Symphonia, then don't play the second. It's HORRIBLE. 
I used to play the gamecube one with a friend of mine and it was all fun times, but the Wii one feel weird, the plot is stale, the controls are awkward, and there's no upgrade on graphics or music from the first one!
snippet.textOriginal:
If you loved the first Tales of Symphonia, then don't play the second. It's HORRIBLE. 
I used to play the gamecube one with a friend of mine and it was all fun times, but the Wii one feel weird, the plot is stale, the controls are awkward, and there's no upgrade on graphics or music from the first one!

snippet.textDisplay:
Hehe, the game is kinda linear, get used to release seal after seal. If you're (assuming) playing the english version then some battles won't use it's original bgm which is kinda sad.
There is perhaps a few (just a few) more good bgms such as this one later on by the way.
